com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.criteria

Interface Criteria<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SqliteCriteria

    public interface Criteria<T>

    This interface represents a query for a particular persistent class. Criteria queries consist of Criterion, which act as restrictions on a query.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 02/17/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Criteria<T> add(Criterion criterion)
      Adds a Criterion to filter retrieved query results.
      long count()
      Retrieves the number of results for the Criteria query.
      android.database.Cursor cursor()
      Retrieves the database Cursor for the Criteria query.
      java.util.List<Criterion> getCriterion()
      Returns the List of Criterion for this Criteria.
      java.lang.Class<?> getEntityClass()
      Returns the Class associated with this Criteria.
      int getLimit()
      Returns the result set limit for this Criteria.
      ObjectMapper getObjectMapper()
      Returns the ObjectMapper associated with this Criteria.
      int getOffset()
      Returns the offset value for this Criteria.
      Session getSession()
      Retrieves the Session this Criteria is attached to.
      Criteria<T> limit(int limit)
      Limits the number of query results.
      java.util.List<T> list()
      Retrieves the query results as a List.
      Criteria<T> offset(int offset)
      Offsets the result set by the given amount.
      java.lang.String toSql()
      Returns the Criteria query in SQL form.
      T unique()
      Retrieves a unique query result for the Criteria query.

        Criteria<T> add(Criterion criterion)
        Adds a Criterion to filter retrieved query results.

        Returns:

        Limits the number of query results.
        Parameters:

      • unique

        T unique()
         throws InfinitumRuntimeException
        Retrieves a unique query result for the Criteria query.
        Returns:
        unique query result or null if no such result exists
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if there was not a unique result for the query
